title: St. Louis de Montfort - True Devotion to Mary: With Preparation
description:
St. Louis de Montfort - True Devotion to Mary: With Preparation for Total Consecration (EPUB, MOBI)

 Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ The Original and Best 1863 Translation from the French by Father 
    Frederick William Faber
 Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Two Books in One, True Devotion to Mary and 33-Day Preparation for 
    Total Consecration
 Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ A Classic Masterpiece of Marian Theology
 Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Includes Prefaces, an Introduction, a Biography of Saint Louis de Montfort 
    and True Devotion Information
 Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Over 68,000 words including illustrations by Bartolome Esteban Murillo


--ABOUT TRUE DEVOTION TO MARY--

This unique version includes two books in one. The original and best Ã¢â‚¬ËœTrue Devotion to Mary,Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ has been translated from French by Father Faber, and a 33-Day Ã¢â‚¬ËœPreparation for Total ConsecrationÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ along with Scripture Readings and Prayers. This version of True Devotion to Mary has the original Latin along with the English, and uses the numbered paragraph format. It also includes paintings by a famous 16th century artist, Bartolome Esteban Murillo.

A Treatise on the True Devotion to the Blessed Virgin or True Devotion to Mary is considered the greatest book on the Blessed Virgin Mary ever written and has been recommended and practiced by eight Popes. This is the original Ã¢â‚¬Ëœscrupulously faithfulÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ translation by Father Frederick William Faber. The great Marian Pope, Blessed Pope John Paul II practiced this Devotion to Mary, in his Letter to the Montfort Fathers he says:

Ã¢â‚¬Å“A work destined to become a classic of Marian spirituality was published 160 years ago. St. Louis Marie Grignion de Montfort wrote the Treatise on True Devotion to the Blessed Virgin at the beginning of the 1700s, but the manuscript remained practically unknown for more than a century. When, almost by chance, it was at last discovered in 1842 and published in 1843, the work was an instant success, proving extraordinarily effective in spreading the Ã¢â‚¬Å“true devotionÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ to the Most Holy Virgin. I myself, in the years of my youth, found reading this book a great help. There I found the answers to my questions, for at one point I had feared that if my devotion to Mary became too great, it might end up compromising the supremacy of the worship owed to Christ. Under the wise guidance of St. Louis Marie, I realized that if one lives the mystery of Mary in Christ this risk does not exist. In fact, this SaintÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Mariological thought is rooted in the mystery of the Trinity and in the truth of the Incarnation of the Word of God.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½

Ã¢â‚¬Å“My motto; Ã¢â‚¬ËœTotus TuusÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ is inspired by the teaching of St. Louis Marie Grignion de Montfort. These two words express total belonging to Jesus through Mary: Ã¢â‚¬ËœTuus totus ego sum, et omnia mea tua sunt,Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ St Louis Marie wrote, and he translates his words: Ã¢â‚¬ËœI am all yours, and all that I have is yours, O most loving Jesus, through Mary, your most holy MotherÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ (Treatise on True Devotion, n. 233). This SaintÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s teaching has had a profound influence on the Marian devotion of many of the faithful and on my own life. It is a lived teaching of outstanding ascetic and mystical depth, expressed in a lively and passionate style that makes frequent use of images and symbols.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½

Ã¢â‚¬Å“All our perfection,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ St. Louis Marie Grignion de Montfort writes, Ã¢â‚¬Å“consists in being conformed, united and consecrated to Jesus Christ; and therefore, the most perfect of all devotions is, without any doubt, that which most perfectly conforms, unites and consecrates us to Jesus Christ. Now, Mary being the most conformed of all creatures to Jesus Christ, it follows that, of all devotions, that which most consecrates and conforms the soul to Our Lord is devotion to his holy Mother, and that the more a soul is consecrated to Mary, the more it is consecrated to Jesus (Treatise on True Devotion, n. 120).Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½

Ã¢â‚¬Å“When we praise her, love her, honour her or give anything to her, it is God who is praised, God who is loved, God who is glorified, and it is to God that we give, through Mary and in Mary (Treatise on True Devotion, n. 225).Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½
